CatDescriptText: Lorraine Evans, waitress, Pittsburgh 19 and Mrs. Bobby Gallagher, housewife, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in the Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 2, 1960, pg. A1 question reads: Do you think religion will play a major part in the choosing of the presidential candidate? If so, why?"  Evans answer reads: "No, because the candidate is not elected because of his religion, but on his merits, and what he has to offer."  Gallagher's answer reads: "I don't think so.  I don't think that religion today plays any part in the election.  I think that the religious issues have been played up too much by the opposition."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Lorraine Evans wearing light colored blouse with bow, and eyeglasses, standing in front of block wall; Portrait of Mrs. Bobby Gallagher wearing ribbed top and cardigan over shoulders, standing in front of store window
